Texto: 
mild aphasia
mild right arm and leg weakness
surgery followed by chemotherapy and radiation
enhancing mass left parietal lobe with surrounding vasogenic edema.
breast cancer, metastatic to brain
• primary glioma
• meningioma
• metastatic disease
60 year old woman recently diagnosed with breast cancer and just beginning chemotherapy.  patient had a seizure and was admitted to outside hospital.  ct scan revealed left parietal lobe mass.
this lesion was noted to have a broad based dural component, but no dural tail.  meningioma was thought to be a possible preoperative diagnosis, but less likely.
